True Creation

By the understanding of the Soul Stewards and other divine atman, True creation is an infinite, a-temporal space of infinite dimensions, occupied by a finite number of atman and endless supply of unbound anicca and mana. It is all things simoultaneously, forever and for a single moment.

Appearance

True Creation bears no physics which allow for it to have any appearance in the manner of conventional creations, however it may have an appearance if veiwed from within a Creation, such as during the final moments of a Creation's collapse due to mana depletion. In such cases its infinite nature creates an impression of simoultaneous perfect white completeness and still black emptiness.

Creations

A connected mass, or 'lake' of mana-infused anicca within True Creation, or that store of mana, anicca, and atman within a Girdle, is commonly refereed to as a Creation.

Transference

Due to the nature of time and the infinity of True Creation, a mass of mana-infused anicca which is separated from another is permenantly separated, and incapable of ever rejoining its original Creation, or of joining another. Normal travel between creations is thereby impossible, as is the conept of Time Travel, which would otherwise be an inevitable by-product of such travel.

Unity

Because all of True Creation is understood to exist in a single, infinite moment of balance, the concept of unity allows that all creations are in-fact interconnected. Among other implications, this theoretically allows for the circumvention of mechanics which otherwise prevent Transference, and even allows for events such as Creation-collisions, temporal intersections between creations, and more - though all such things, including Transference, must be Predestined Events, or both creations involved must share some Internal Mechanism for direct Transference from one to the other.

Nature

Understanding of the nature of existence only reaches so high as the Soul Stewards and other divine atman, who being unbound or bound to trinitys of their own making understand their place in the Balance. Therefore, whether or not this a-temporal Balance exists within a yet grander scheme can only be theorised.

Chaotic Theory

It is possible that True Creation is but a single infinitesimal moment in a purely chaotic world, which is randomised moment to moment.

Meta-timeline Theory

It is possible that True Creation is but a single infinitesimal moment in a sequence of single, infinitesimal moments each near-indiscernible from the next, or that its entire breadth and variance represents the entirety of such a timeline too great for any atman to perceive.

Stagnation Theory

It is possible that True Creation is the inert, post-apocalyptic aftermath of a once-temporal super-creation in which free divine atman fought with hunger over mortal atman; where atman were created and destroyed, rather than just existing in a balanced, static state.
